author: Tim_Johnson
title: Pretty cute, but probably limited appeal
review:
Glow-in-the-dark-o-rama

This caught my eye when Monster Fighters was announced, mostly because of the glow-in-the-dark pieces which I'm keen on, and the three cute ghosts. I was in my Dark Age when ghosts first came out. These new ones have a properly ghoulish face rather than those smiling ghosts of the 1990s and the subtle detailing makes for more personality overall. They look especially funny when you put two together as though they're having a conversation about something rather shocking. 

Also in glow-in-the-dark colour are twelve 1x1 cones and three lightsaber rods; these are unique to this set (although have been available in the past in old glow-in-the-dark colours) and are very useful pieces. There's a 4x4 radar dish with a jack o' lantern face which I suppose will be fun for Hallowe'en MOCs, plus a large flamey thing which is marbled trans-light green / glow in dark.

The other exciting thing is that this is a NEW glow-in-the-dark colour and an improvement over the old glow-in-the-dark opaque. In daylight the pieces have a nice shiny lustre with a slightly more grayish green tinge. Much better than the greeny-yellow milky version of old. By night, they are brighter than the old opaque (unless it’s just that old ones fade with age?) but a bit less bright than the old trans-glow-in-the-dark.

Other parts of interest

  • The 1x4 brick with side studs in dark red! There are two here.
  • Also new in dark red is the 3x4 wedge brick, if you find that of any use!
  • Perhaps more useful are the left and right 12x3 wedge plates, again new in dark red.
  • Black slippers (45 degree 2x1 slopes with 2/3 cutout) are new this year and the twelve here are the highest number you’ll find in a set to date. Very useful.
  • Black Technic pulley wheels have not been seen since 2005; again there are twelve.
  • The train wheels with counterweights, seen only in Emerald Night so far.
  • Two Gold Fez hats! Used to great effect by adding a gold cone on top. Otherwise only available in The Werewolf.
  • The crossbow and harpoons are in flat silver; as yet only available in this set and The Mummy.
  • There are nine pistols! Overkill? ;o) No, they’re used in an “NPU” way.
  • Notable only for their quantities are the white Battle Droid arms, white barbs and white long bones.

The build

The build starts with the dark red/blay plane which is quite cute. The body has a good shape and some nice detailing. The wings feel a tad basic and the chunky flick-fire missiles rather heavy-handed. 

Then to the train engine which was my favourite part of the build, especially the central cylinder. You know those ugly Technic pin holes on the edges of 4x4 round bricks? Great to see them put to use here. 

Next up are the two small carriages with bat wings. Based on the box pictures these wings were my least favourite part of the set, but I was thrilled to discover they actually flap as you move the train along! In a duckie-pull-along kinda way. Hilarious. 

The final carriage has more Gothic personality to it than the rest of the set. It’s a cage and the inwardly curved barred gates, made of Droid arms and bones, are slightly Gaudi-esque. I wouldn’t like to be locked up in it.

There are repetitive moments, mostly with the ‘ghost greebling’ of bones, barbs and Droid arms. For me the barbs don’t look right as I don’t associate spikiness with ghosts, maybe they wanted the haunted train to look more evil. This set is aimed 8-14 and I think the younger end might find a couple of steps tricky.

Minifigs

The two mortal figs are excellent: both extreme characterisations. The man is really cheesy and the woman is FIERCE. She has a scar down the middle of her face, wears a red corset, carries a crossbow and keeps a spare harpoon in her hair. I was disappointed to see that the play images suggest locking HER up in the cage… really can’t imagine her allowing herself to be shoved in there, whereas HE looks just like the kind of dork who would get caught by ghosts.

Summary

In the ‘cool and scarey’ stakes, ghosts don’t really stack up against werewolves and vampires, and the cuteness of the set doesn't really help there; so I suspect this Monster Fighters set will appeal more to the younger age bracket. The train is heavily detailed; maybe girls will enjoy this more than boys. I like the finished set and having a train and a plane always makes for good play scenarios. Perhaps a skeleton or two would have added to the fun. I’m looking forward to the Haunted House as a more appropriate home for my three ghosts, and perhaps the train will act as their transport there.

author: OWF
title: A Good Mix
review:
Box/Instructions

The box is a bit too large comparing with what is inside of it.
Could be a bit more compact which would make the set more easy to transport.

Parts

There are lots of glow-in-the-dark pieces, and the predominant colors are black and white.

Minifigures

Most of the minifigures are awesome.

[img]http://cache.lego.com/upload/contentTemplating/MonsterFightersCharactersMonsterFighters/images/pic81A08FE1B6C0C0A48B24421EF16AF0E9.png[/img]
Ann Lee looks like a brave girl, always ready for new challenges.
She has a spear in her hair, always ready to reload the crossbow.
She also has very nice details, such as a red corset on her torso or a pack of garlic at her hips.

[img]http://cache.lego.com/upload/contentTemplating/MonsterFightersCharactersMonsters/images/pic60EC6E9FD3D4F9DE1A80734080FAE878.png[/img]
Ghosts looks great. The new ghost seems to be more cartoonish comparing with the old one, but would be a very nice addition to any collection.
They are glowing in the dark more intensely than the previous ghosts, and at light they look more like a natural white rather than older models of ghosts.

[img]http://cache.lego.com/upload/contentTemplating/MonsterFightersCharactersMonsterFighters/images/picED9EC37BBE5F68BCF8404AC170A4C89B.png[/img]
Frank Rock is the most ugly minifigure in this set and maybe the most ugly minifigure in the whole series of Monster Fighters.
His jacket among that glasses and hairstyle makes him to look more like a rock star rather than like an adventurer or a monster fighter.
His individual parts might be useful to any collection, but as it is here, looks very bad.

The build

Building the plane will give a normal experience, being not so hard and not so easy.
There are some interesting pieces such as barrel or hose.
I would say that a smaller plane would give a better proportion between the plane and the train.

The locomotive is the most interesting build in this set.
It takes the much longer time to build it, and has lost of nice combinations between bricks. It also has much variety and it will not be boring to build it.
There are also many very useful bricks that may be used for western and not only.

The wagon (where sits the ghost), is the most boring part of this set.
You'd have to build two identical wagons, and they are extremely brainless without any challenge into placing the bricks.
Considering there is a very basic model and you'd have to repeat the building again, it may not bring to you much fun there.

The prison wagon is decent challenge into finishing this set.
There are lots of bones, and all together will build the 4 doors for the prison.
The doors can be opened and there is enough space to place one prisoner.

[img]http://cache.lego.com/upload/contentTemplating/MonsterFightersProductsFeatures/otherfiles/download6CE04E16D92F05E8840E2A7ED8315AA2.jpg[/img]

The completed model

The complete model looks very nice, having two playable vehicles.

There are lots of glow-in-the-dark pieces and it will look great for a kid or any collector.

The train is not too long and not too short, having 48 centimeters (19 inches).

The plane has 18 centimeters (7 inches).

Summary

This set is a very nice addition and it's worth due to new model of ghosts and all other glow-in-the-dark pieces.

author: Topcop999
title: A personal favourite!
review:
I was very excited to see this in Argos a few months ago and I thought I would decide to review it now. This is easily my favourite Monster Fighter set along with the Vampyre's hearse and I'll get into why I feel that way...

Pros

  • Excellently designed train with tons of intricate details all over.
  • Three of the new mould Ghosts.
  • Not just the train for your money but a plane also increasing play value by a large amount.
  • Flapping wings on small train carts are amusing and well made.
  • The plane is nothing of a 'filler' its just as detailed as the train is.
  • Glow in the dark elements all over the train as well as the Ghost minifigs too.

Cons

  • All but the locomotive can't run on track but you can easily modify that with some of these http://www.bricklink.com/catalogItem.asp?P=55423.
  • Gets slightly monotonous to build with two identical carts.
  • Price is a bit steep so if your not 100% on this wait for an Amazon discount of something.

I think its a great train but most people knock it for not being able to run on tracks but you can always modify it to run on tracks and 9V motorise it if you like, Power functions is another story though. I highly recommend this to any train enthusiasts or fans of the Monster Fighters theme as its a great model when build and looks stunning especially in the dark.

author: Firox_5000
title: Ghoulish train
review:
This set was the third monster fighters set I bought which was during a 3 for 2 offer at Argos which this set was the item to come free in the purchasing. This set contains 741 pieces [most of which are small bones,spikes etc;/ which took me just over an hour to build and construct.

 

The set includes five minifigures Frank Rock, Ann Lee, and three ghost figures. The ghosts are a great welcomed return as they haven't been made in lego for years. The ones in this set are certainly an improovement from the old ones as their masks are more sleek and conceals more of the figure body and also glows in the dark.

 

The other figures in this set are the good guys Ann Lee and Frank Rock. Ann Lee is neatly designed figure with a double sided torso and some clever leg printing of material for weapons and equipment. Anne lee's hairpiece is very detailed and pointed and although resembles that of the cave woman's is a great hair piece. The figure also has a spare arrow in her hair and comes with a bow and another arrow.

 

Frank Rock is clearly the weakest figure and is perhaps the least inspiring figure overall in the whole monster fighter series as his hair piece is clearly too similar to the minifigure series and his torso although double sided is not so nicely printed. 

 

Other than the figures, the set includes to main objects. The hero's fighter place and the ghost train itself. The hero fighter plane which is the first object to be finished in the building. The completed model has a rather simple and classic look to it and is also surprisingly larger than it seems. The plane has a one piece propeller at the front and also has gun pieces made to resemble the engines at the side of it. The plane also comes with a ghost sucktion guns and the storage area itself which is made of two barrel pieces. While it clearly doesn't actually have a playability function is a nice deal to the plane. There are also flick fire missles included which although increase playability can be awkward to fire well. The plane overall is a very nicely designed model.

 

The second and main object of the set is the ghost train itself which comes with three carriages and the train itself. The main locomotive is nicely detailed with a neat scary face at the front of the model with a toxic green flame from on top as well as spiked curved pieces at the side which add greatly to the menacing look of the locomotive. The inside of this unit also has a neat feature of a small fire in the engine room which adds to the playability and slight realisticness of the train model. There is also the rather cool ghost moonstone on the top of the train too.

 

Unfortunately, I can't really same the same for the rest of the train as it seems rather lack luster in the inbetween carriages are exacly the same and seem a bit basic, plain and resemblent of ninjago sets when the skelentons where around. The only good thing of these areas other than holding the ghost figures are the cool geared feature of the wings going up and down when the trains being pushed on the floor.

 

The final carriage which is the prison carriage is slightly better as the bones add an effect here as being containers of the prisoner and make it look rather creepy however the problem of getting the figure in and out easily loses it's greantess.  

 

Overall the set is not the worst one out there definately not the best either as parts of this set seem to resemble phase one models of ninjago which is a theme I am not particulay fond of but the playability, classic plane and the fact so much of the model shines beautifally in the dark make up for this as many parts of the train including the front, ghosts and spikes all glow which to my knowledge is the highest number of illuminous parts in one set which does drive up some marks. But seeing the fact other than the ghosts the set contains no stand out figures, repeated structures and the high asking price of £60 which this set should be £50 at the max , it's a set that is very mixed in greatness and disapointment.

 

Overall I would recommend this set if you like monsters, ghosts trains glow in the dark pieces, playability, classic planes  and those collecting Monster Fighter sets. Other than that, I would only recommend buying this set if you find it reduced or in an offer e.g 3 for 2. If you want to buy monster fighter sets, save your money for the mummy and swamp sets as they include the main heroes that appear in this set.

author: beegeedee
title: Spooktastbrick set.
review:
Ghost Train is the third largest set in the Monster Fighters theme featuring an airplane for the heroes and a train with 3 carriages for the ghosts. I say heroes but I have to say these so-called heroes look thuggish and in a battle you'd want the ghost to win...

For those from Europe, in Ireland at least the price in the local toy store is 71.99 Euro.

Box/Instructions

The box is a rather large affair which is what you would expect for a set with 740ish pieces but on opening you soon realise the parts occupy about 1/2 of the box. I understand that a smaller box at this price it may look like it's not value for money.

The instructions are in the form of 2 smallish books and was pleasantly surprised to find they were bagged and reinforced with cardboard. Book one covers the airplane and the train engine while book 2 covers the 3 carriages for the train.

Parts

Parts are spread across 6 bags with 2 hoses loose in the bottom of the box. while the part count is high you realise quickly there's lots of small parts like the white horns and skeleton arms which together is about 50 pcs.

Other parts of note are:

  • The bones. I like bone pieces and can there can never be enough of these IMO
  • The glow-in-the-dark 1x1 cones
  • The glow-in-the-dark 4x4 dish with halloween-type face on it.
  • The glow-in-the-dark flame piece
  • The wings - 2 sets
  • The black train wheels for the main train
  • The 12 black pulley wheels
  • 2 reddish brown tubs
  • 10 fin pieces
  • The black cow pusher
  • A chain - the part supplied seemed poor quality however and had little bits of extra plastic all over it. It's a little disappointing.

Also, lots of 2x2 black bow pieces which are handy to have.

Spare pieces number 33 which include 2 train wheels (they come in 2 packs of 3 and only 2 are used from each pack) and the usual 1x1 round plates, skeleton arms, white horns etc.

Finally a modern orange brick separator is included which is always welcome and handy.

Minifigures

There are 5 minifgures. the 2 heroes are well printed and their faces are both double-sided. these are the same 2 heroes as in the mummy and swamp creature sets so if it's just those you want then the small sets are a better purchase.

My personal favourites so far are the 3 ghosts. Nothing more exciting except they are nicely done, white bodies, black head and the hood over the top. They really really glow after a little light to charge them up.

The build

Bags 1 and 2 along with the 2 loose hoses build the airplane which is actually quite large. Equipped with flick missiles and what, I assume, is a ghost vacuum to attack the ghosts is a nice build.

Bags 3 and 4 are for the train. 3 contains the majority of the cabin and the front part of the train which is finished off by bag 4 which has the tank, funnel and creepy vine-like constructions along the side made from black fins and the white horns...nice touch

Bag 5 makes the 2 carriages featuring bat wings. A nice little technique is used for getting the wings to move but it would have been nice to vary them rather than use exactly the same design for both.

Bag 6 builds the prison carriage and is actually quite fiddly with all those skeleton arms for the doors. The end result is really effective and definitely looks a little creepy.

Overall it takes just over an hour to put together and there's lots of intricate parts (like the doors) which take more time in general.

The completed model

Together the model looks good. Dark, glow-y in places and quite satisfying. As an actual train it's a little disappointing. The use of rubber with pulley wheels on the carriage means a lot of thought to motorising would be needed. On the plus side for a kid without other trains it can be pulled along the floor wings all flappy and it looks good.

Summary

A good set but with a bit more work could have been great. 3 different carriages would have been nice, even if just variations on a theme. A few more glowing parts so the black stood out more or perhaps on the carriage doors so you could see inside in the dark wouldn't go amiss. Or a sound brick with a spooky sound or something. Ah, we always want more.

Value for money? Well, this is tricky. There's an abundance of small pieces so on the surface the price per piece seems really good but if you consider this then probably the set is a little overpriced. Saying that, the glowing pieces probably cost a little more to make...the short answer is probably a little overpriced - down by 5 GBP/10Euro.

On sale is a no brainer - I believe I paid around 44 euro/35 pounds for this set.

Would I recommend the set - absolutely but not at RRP. Get even a small discount and it's totally worth the money.

author: motobuchi
title: A little more Ninjago then ghostly, but fun enough.
review:
I was most exited for this set for the Ghost minifigures and the Plane (which I might actually use for Scarecrow in my Batman collection with its hoses and fear gas barrel).  The train itself is a little lackluster - it looks more like an evil Ninjago set than a phantom ghost train.  There are a lot of curves, bones, and dragon wings.  I was expecting something more rickety, and maybe more use of transparent bricks since it is a GHOST train. 


Box/Instructions

The box really sells the action of the scene - with Frank piloting his plane and Ann hanging down with her crossbow, aiming at the ghosts menacingly floating around their ghost train. Easily one of the coolest looking boxes.


Instructions are what you expect.


Parts

If you're a fan of glow-in-the dark pieces, this set (and entire theme) is for you.  In light, they're a nice off-white.  The ghost train comes with glowing ghosts, cones, rods, a tall flame, and a giant jack-o-lantern face at the front of the train. 


There's a great mass of bones as well.  As far as other unique pieces, there's a hose and a barrel as well as some train wheels.


Minifigures

Great minifigs.  The ghosts have ghoulish faces and flowing cloth detail – an awesome upgrade from the older, flatter, friendlier looking ghosts.  The new ones also have a little tail on the back of their heads - a cool new addition that really makes the minifig.

The remaining minifigures, Ann Lee and Frank Rock are probably my favorite heroes in this Lego theme.  Both have great hair and detail.  I love Ann's crossbow and her arrows being able to stay in her hair.


The build

The train is a bit of a repetitive build.  Two of the cars are identical and pretty basic and the remaining two have similar enough anatomy to feel like deja-vu.  


The completed model

I was a little underwhelmed by the train.  It didn't look like a ghost train to me, especially if there were no ghosts around it.  It just looks like a scary train.  The rail details on the front, as well as all the bone spikes and wings make it look a little like something from a Ninjago set.


Summary

The Monster Fighters theme is easily one of my favorite Lego® themes so far.  This set, however, was my last purhcase.  If you're looking in a similar price range, I would recommend buying the Vampyre Castle over this.  Cooler minifigures, much more attractive set, and one of the coolest vehicles I've seen made by Lego.  Equally as cool is the Crazy Scientist and His Monster, which uses light-up bricks.  


Ghost Train was my least favorite of this theme.

author: Lint
title: A horror themed marvel
review:
The Skinny

The Ghost Train is an instantly eye catching and appealing set to both adults and children. With a great build and fantastic array of pieces you really can't go wrong with this set. Includes 2 monster fighters, 3 ghosts, a prop plane and the ghost train which is made up on the engine, a prison carriage and two bat winged 'carts'.

Pros

  • Fantastic build, I always love being introduced to new ways of building things and there has been a couple of ideas that are new to me. Even the prop plane was a surprise fun build.
  • Lots of ghosts! Which now populate my 10228 haunted house.
  • Rubber tyres I love rubber tyres!
  • Looks great (in the light)
  • Fantastic array of pieces including typical black and white 'skeletal' parts, goo tubes, glow in the dark horns and bones, green flames, train wheels, that horror-the-tank-engine FACE... need I go on?
  • Compared to other sets in this price class, respectable value for money.

Cons

  • The human 'monster fighters' are the same as, and I believe virtually unchanged, to those found in the two cheapest monster fighters sets. I suppose this could be a blessing for the wallet for those hoping to pass on this set.
  • Flick fire missiles. Lego needs to ban these outside of the Star Wars line.
  • Looks a little uninspired in the dark with the glow in the dark parts. A common problem with most monster fighters sets.
  • The flapping gimmick sometimes gets stuck or works with varying effectiveness. Could have had a better design.
  • The flapping 'carts' as a whole are pretty silly. I would have appreciated some other type of carriage to give the train more 'body'.
  • Not much opportunity to integrate the power functions unit with the design of the engine. I'm sure it has been done by builders better than me, but I do not think it is easy.

Conclusion

Buy this set if it's still hanging around the shelves of your local store. Nuff said.

author: SanMams91
title: Ghost Train
review:
This is a great set, despite many people complaining that the train isn't compatible with the lego tracks. 

Box/Instructions

Box is good, instructions clear, protected.

Parts

Not many usable parts, but a lot of black.

Minifigures

Even though minifigures are not at all the focus of the set, the three gloomy ghosts are fantastic to have. Ann Lee is well detailed, as is Frank Rock and really one can't complain too much about the figures.

The build

The build was actually really fun, until I got to the repetitive two cars. Lego was being a little lazy here and could've given the train at least one differently built car. That is one negative about the set. The plane build was very fun.

The completed model

The model is fantastic, a child could play with it for hours and an adult could display it on a desk or shelf and it would look visually stunning. Flapping wings when the train moves gives the set a fun vibe and the wings imitate the sounds of bones clanking against one another. There is a little prison cell designed for Frank, Ann, or any of the ghosts to be placed within. The plane provides one with flick fire missiles, which gives the set even more playability.

Overall opinion

Fantastic set, I would say underrated by most. However, price is a little high, so if you could get it on a discount, it's perfect.

author: hoobie_human_Studios
title: Lego Monster Fighters 9467-1 Ghost Train
review:
The Lego Monster Fighters 1967-1 Ghost Train was released in 2012 for 59.99 USD, with 5 minifigures and 741 pieces.

The set has 5 minifigures: Ann Lee, Frank Rock, and 3 Ghosts. I think all these figures are good, the frowning face looks better then the smile on the ghost in my opinion. I still like that hairpiece from Frank Rock, it looks like Elivis. Ann Lee's leg printing is really usefully, and I like her face print.

There are two builds in the set: The Airplane, and the Ghost Train. The airplane is one of the better looking Lego airplanes. I like older airplanes more and I think this plane captures that perfectly. The Ghost Train is still my favorite Lego train. This could be due to nostalgia, because this was awesome as a kid, but it still looks amazing.

Overall, this is a good set in my opinion. I would recommend it.
